summary: An email from August 14, 2019, forwarding a tasking request about program banding for FY20. The email acknowledges the recipient is busy with the Epstein case and requests a call to discuss their program.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Sent the original tasking request on August 12, 2019, regarding banding for CAC and HT for FY20, from the Violent Crimes Section Crimes Against Children Human Trafficking Unit (CACHTU).

events.title: Tasking request for FY20 banding
events.description: An SSA from the CACHTU sends an email requesting information on how to band CAC (Crimes Against Children) and HT (Human Trafficking) for Fiscal Year 2020.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 14, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019 and before his death in August 2019.
The recipient ('M') is identified as being busy with the Epstein case, indicating active work on the investigation.
The forwarded tasking originates from the FBI's Violent Crimes Section, specifically the Crimes Against Children Human Trafficking Unit (CACHTU).
The subject matter involves program planning ('banding') for Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking for Fiscal Year 2020.
The document is a routine administrative email that contextualizes the Epstein case within broader FBI unit priorities.
